description: Returns the status of the last grouping or ungrouping action for each resource in the specified application group.

parameters.name: Group
parameters.description: The application group identifier, expressed as an Amazon resource name (ARN) or the application group name.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: The filter name and value pair that is used to return more specific results from a list of resources. (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to obtain more specific results from the list of grouping statuses. The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. One or more filter values. Allowed filter values vary by resource filter name, and are case-sensitive. (string) ---

nested_params.name: Name
nested_params.description: The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive.

nested_params.name: Values
nested_params.description: One or more filter values. Allowed filter values vary by resource filter name, and are case-sensitive.

nested_items.name: Group
nested_items.description: The application group identifier, expressed as an Amazon resource name (ARN) or the application group name.

nested_items.name: GroupingStatuses
nested_items.description: Returns details about the grouping or ungrouping status of the resources in the specified application group.

nested_items.name: ResourceArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon resource name (ARN) of a resource.

nested_items.name: Action
nested_items.description: Describes the resource grouping action with values of GROUP or UNGROUP.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Describes the resource grouping status with values of SUCCESS, FAILED, IN_PROGRESS, or SKIPPED.

nested_items.name: ErrorMessage
nested_items.description: A message that explains the ErrorCode.

nested_items.name: ErrorCode
nested_items.description: Specifies the error code that was raised.

nested_items.name: UpdatedAt
nested_items.description: A timestamp of when the status was last updated.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: If present, indicates that more output is available than is included in the current response. Use this value in the NextToken request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the next part of the output. You should repeat this until the NextToken response element comes back as null.
